content.text:
[cron:9cd37ed1-5a97-42df-9e3a-96ba8bb65a6e media-ready-check] ðŸ“º Media Check: Query Jellyfin/Sonarr/Radarr for newly available content. If anything new is ready to watch (hasFile==true that wasn't before), use `message` tool with `channel: whatsapp`, `to: +972544419002` to notify Alex what's now available. Track state in memory/media-check-state.json to avoid duplicate notifications. If nothing new, output HEARTBEAT_OK.
Current time: Tuesday, February 10th, 2026 â€” 2:53 PM (Asia/Jerusalem)

content.thinking:
This is a media check cron job. I need to:
1. Check Jellyfin/Sonarr/Radarr for newly available content
2. Compare against memory/media-check-state.json to detect what's NEW
3. If new content exists, notify Alex via message tool with channel: whatsapp, to: +972544419002
4. Update the state file
5. If nothing new, respond HEARTBEAT_OK

Let me start by reading the current state file, then querying the media services.

content.text: I'll check for new media content and notify if anything is ready.

arguments.command: curl -s "http://10.100.102.8:8989/api/v3/series?apikey=30ce9e1d7c4041e99e2cfc4492596df4" | jq '[.[] | select(.statistics.episodeFileCount > 0) | {title: .title, id: .id, seasonCount: .statistics.seasonCount, episodeCount: .statistics.episodeFileCount, monitored: .monitored}] | sort_by(.title)'

curl -s "http://10.100.102.8:7878/api/v3/movie?apikey=cd20b18c1b8d466eadda2e6573a3c58f" | jq '[.[] | select(.hasFile == true) | {title: .title, id: .id, year: .year, hasFile: .hasFile, monitored: .monitored}] | sort_by(.title)'
